neighbors.name: John David Macintyre
neighbors.claims: John D. Macintyre has collected over $400,000 in federal farm subsidies since 1995, indicating a significant farming operation [EWG Farm Subsidy Database](https://farm.ewg.org/persondetail.php?custnumber=A03192501) ([farm.ewg.org](https://farm.ewg.org/persondetail.php?custnumber=A03192501#:~:text=Total%20%20,%24400%2C703)). Subsidy records show his farming activities in both McHenry County (about $175,738) and Boone County (about $224,965), reflecting landholdings across the county line [EWG Farm Subsidy Database](https://farm.ewg.org/persondetail.php?custnumber=A03192501) ([farm.ewg.org](https://farm.ewg.org/persondetail.php?custnumber=A03192501#:~:text=County%20%20,%24400%2C703)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Have a respected agriculture peer reach out to Macintyre, emphasizing how the project will protect farmland and address any drainage or road use concerns in the area.

neighbors.name: Avalos Daniela Vega Martin
neighbors.claims: Daniela Vega Martin Avalos is listed as the owner of a parcel in Marengo Township, McHenry County [McHenry County Property Tax Inquiry](https://mchenryil.devnetwedge.com/) ([www.mchenrycountyhistory.org](https://www.mchenrycountyhistory.org/property-research/#:~:text=1,Inquiry)). No references to her involvement or statements in local civic matters were found in available public records or news archives ([marengo-township.org](https://marengo-township.org/2021-past-meeting-minutes#:~:text=2021%20Past%20Meeting%20Minutes%20Town,Download%20Marengo%20Monthly%20Meeting)).
neighbors.influence_justification: No public profile or civic roles

approach_recommendations.engage: Use a one-on-one, neighborly approach to introduce the project, listening to any concerns she may have and ensuring she feels included in the information flow.

neighbors.name: Union Operating Co LLC
neighbors.claims: Union Operating Co. LLC is an Illinois limited liability company listed as owner of three farmland parcels in Marengo Township (PINs above) ([mchenryil.devnetwedge.com](https://mchenryil.devnetwedge.com/search#:~:text=To%20access%20your%20property%20tax,with%20more%20explanation%20and%20information)). No record of this entity is found in Illinois corporate registration databases, suggesting it is a private landholding vehicle with no public-facing operations ([www.mchenrycountyhistory.org](https://www.mchenrycountyhistory.org/property-research/#:~:text=Research%20Your%20Property%20,the%20information%2C%20you%20can%20use)). The LLC has not appeared in local news or court filings, indicating its activity is limited to passive land ownership (no development projects or public statements on record) ([www.mchenrycountyhistory.org](https://www.mchenrycountyhistory.org/property-research/#:~:text=Research%20Your%20Property%20,the%20information%2C%20you%20can%20use)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Owns farmland only; no known community role or political activity; low public visibility

approach_recommendations.engage: Quietly engage through informal contact with owner or agent; emphasize respect for farming operations and offer assurances project won’t harm their land use

neighbors.name: McHenry Co. Conservation Dist.
neighbors.claims: The McHenry County Conservation District (MCCD) is a governmental entity created by voter referendum in 1971 to protect open space and natural resources ([mchenrycountyhistory.org](https://mchenrycountyhistory.org/day-mchenry-county-history#:~:text=,Woodstock%20Jaycees%20organized)). MCCD currently manages nearly 25,000 acres of land across the county, including about 6,646 acres of farmland under agricultural lease programs ([orgfarmlandsurvey.com](https://orgfarmlandsurvey.com/mchenry/#:~:text=,total%20acres)). The District’s mission is to preserve wildlife habitat, water quality, and scenic land; it often reviews development proposals for environmental impacts and advocates for mitigation or preservation measures ([www.mchenrydems.org](https://www.mchenrydems.org/mccd_proposition#:~:text=What%20is%20it%20about%3F)) ([mchenrycountyhistory.org](https://mchenrycountyhistory.org/day-mchenry-county-history#:~:text=,Woodstock%20Jaycees%20organized)). MCCD is well-established and respected locally, with taxing authority and a history of mobilizing public support for conservation funding (e.g., recent tax referenda) ([www.dailyherald.com](https://www.dailyherald.com/20241120/local-politics/mchenry-county-voters-approve-conservation-district-tax-request/#:~:text=Local%20Politics%20,McHenry%20County%20voters%20appear%20to)) ([www.mchenrycountyblog.com](https://www.mchenrycountyblog.com/2024/11/05/conservation-district-33-tax-hike-referendum-reported-losing-by-271-votes-with-all-precincts-counted/#:~:text=Conservation%20District%2033,the%20map%20showing%20the%20results)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Government agency owning extensive land; strong public mandate for conservation; ability to sway public opinion and officials on environmental grounds

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage MCCD leadership early to highlight project’s minimal environmental footprint; offer habitat enhancements or partnerships to align with their conservation goals; address any concerns about wildlife and open space openly to prevent opposition

neighbors.name: West Grant Develop Inc
neighbors.claims: West Grant Development, Inc. is an Illinois domestic corporation formed on May 5, 2005 ([businessprofiles.com](https://businessprofiles.com/details/west-grant-development-inc/IL-64158619#:~:text=,05)). The company’s registered agent at formation was local attorney Donald F. Franz, and its initial officers included James Athans (President) and David Klesmith (Secretary) ([businessprofiles.com](https://businessprofiles.com/details/west-grant-development-inc/IL-64158619#:~:text=,DAVID%20KLESMITH%20SAME%20Secretary)). West Grant Development Inc owns multiple adjacent parcels along West Grant Highway, indicating a strategic land position likely intended for future development or resale. The corporation has no visible business operations or website, and no public records of active development projects on its Marengo Township land (suggesting it is holding the property, possibly for speculative investment) ([businessprofiles.com](https://businessprofiles.com/details/west-grant-development-inc/IL-64158619#:~:text=,DAVID%20KLESMITH%20SAME%20Secretary)) ([www.chicagocityscape.com](https://www.chicagocityscape.com/companies.php?company=James+Athans#:~:text=Chicago%20Cityscape%20,where%20James%20Athans%20has%20projects)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Controls several highway-frontage parcels; led by local business figures; potential resources for development but no public outreach to date

approach_recommendations.engage: Identify current decision-maker (e.g., surviving officer or agent) and discuss mutually beneficial options (buyout or joint venture); stress how proposed project could raise neighboring land values; monitor for any competitive development plans they might have

neighbors.name: Burma Rd Grain LLC
neighbors.claims: Burma Rd Grain LLC appears to be a privately-held Illinois farm entity owning a parcel on Burma Road in Marengo Township ([www.mchenrycountyhistory.org](https://www.mchenrycountyhistory.org/property-research/#:~:text=Museum%20www,the%20information%2C%20you%20can%20use)). The LLC’s name suggests a focus on grain farming or storage, but it has no listed corporate presence or public information aside from county land records (no business website or news mentions). No state-level filings or UCC liens were found under this name, implying it operates as a family-run farm business without external financing or separate ventures ([www.mchenrycountyhistory.org](https://www.mchenrycountyhistory.org/property-research/#:~:text=Museum%20www,the%20information%2C%20you%20can%20use)). The company’s activities seem limited to agriculture on its land, and it has not publicly stated any position on local development proposals (likely maintaining a low profile) ([www.mchenrycountyhistory.org](https://www.mchenrycountyhistory.org/property-research/#:~:text=Museum%20www,the%20information%2C%20you%20can%20use)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Single-parcel farm ownership; no public or political role; influence confined to personal connections in farming community

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach via local farm networks or cooperative to build trust; reassure that development will not impede farm access or drainage; offer any needed mitigation (e.g., dust control, buffer) to address their farming concerns

neighbors.name: John C Tr et al Martin
Commonwealth Edison Co
neighbors.claims: Commonwealth Edison (ComEd) is Illinois’ largest electric utility, serving Chicago and most of Northern Illinois as a subsidiary of Exelon Corporation [Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Commonwealth_Edison). ComEd has wielded political influence in Illinois – a federal corruption case revealed the company arranged benefits for associates of the Illinois House Speaker in exchange for favorable energy legislation [AP News](https://apnews.com/article/598e993948fd1a2f05a3b80a3da9eeee). ComEd’s service territory spans about 11,400 square miles across northern Illinois (extending to McHenry County), and it maintains local grid infrastructure such as transmission lines and substations on its land holdings [MC2 Energy Services](https://mc2energyservices.com/service_map.php).
neighbors.influence_justification: Dominant regional utility with deep political connections and essential infrastructure; historically willing to exert influence for favorable policies

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage ComEd’s regional external affairs manager to address any grid or safety concerns. Emphasize how the project can improve local reliability or require infrastructure upgrades, aligning with ComEd’s interests to ensure a neutral or supportive stance.

neighbors.name: Union Pacific Railroad Co
neighbors.claims: Union Pacific Railroad Company is a Class I freight railroad operating a 32,100-mile network across the western and midwestern United States, under the parent company Union Pacific Corporation [Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Union_Pacific_Railroad). Union Pacific expanded into northern Illinois by acquiring the Chicago & North Western Railway in 1995, gaining rail lines and yards in the greater Chicago region [Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Union_Pacific_Railroad). The company’s public affairs strategy prioritizes issues directly impacting its rail operations and business performance, indicating it engages locally only when its transportation interests are at stake [Union Pacific Railroad](https://investor.unionpacific.com/ir-resources/political-contributions-policy-and-procedures/).
neighbors.influence_justification: National infrastructure company with legal leverage over its right-of-way but minimal involvement in local community or politics unless rail operations are affected

approach_recommendations.engage: Coordinate with Union Pacific’s property and engineering department on any necessary rail crossing or safety agreements. Otherwise, expect minimal engagement from the railroad as long as the development does not interfere with its operations.

neighbors.name: Freedom Lane LLC
neighbors.claims: Freedom Lane LLC is an Illinois limited liability company that owns multiple parcels of agricultural land in Marengo Township, McHenry County (as identified by the listed PINs) [McHenry County Assessor](https://www.mchenrycountyil.gov/departments/assessments/board-of-review/assessment-records). No public information is readily available about Freedom Lane LLC’s principals or business activities; it appears to be a passive landholding entity with no publicly recorded operations beyond property ownership [McHenry County Assessor](https://www.mchenrycountyil.gov/departments/assessments/board-of-review/assessment-records).
neighbors.influence_justification: Privately held land investor with no known public profile or community role; beneficial owners and intentions are undisclosed

approach_recommendations.engage: Identify the managing member behind Freedom Lane LLC via records or local contacts and engage them discreetly. Align outreach with their financial interests (e.g., offer competitive land terms or buyout) to neutralize potential opposition given their likely investment motive.

overview_summary: Neither neighboring landowner has a documented stance on local development or clean energy projects. One is a long-established farmer with moderate community influence due to extensive landholdings, while the other appears to have a minimal public profile or influence. The neighboring entities include a county conservation authority focused on preserving open land, a small development company holding vacant parcels, and two farm-related LLCs with minimal public profiles. The McHenry County Conservation District wields significant influence and prioritizes environmental and open-space protection. The private LLC owners appear primarily interested in land value and agricultural use, with no overt public stance on development documented. The adjacent organizational landowners include a major electric utility (ComEd), a freight railroad corporation (Union Pacific), and a private landholding LLC (Freedom Lane LLC). ComEd and Union Pacific are large infrastructure entities focused on their operations; both have significant resources but typically remain neutral on local development unless their facilities are directly affected. Freedom Lane LLC appears to be a speculative land investor with little public information available, making its stance on new projects unclear and its influence limited to its ownership of the parcels.
